data.title: [COACHING] How to Update Your LinkedIn Public Profile Settings | Dr. T
data.description:
Want to make the most of your LinkedIn public profile?

Join us live as we walk through the essential LinkedIn Public Profile Settings, including how to customize your profile URL and control what is visible to the public. Whether you're job searching, networking, or building your brand, visibility matters—let’s make sure you’re putting your best digital foot forward!

What You’ll Learn:

✅ How to create a custom LinkedIn profile URL for easy sharing
✅ What profile sections you should make public vs. private
✅ How to adjust visibility settings to enhance your professional brand
✅ Tips to boost credibility and discoverability on LinkedIn

Whether you're a job seeker, a professional, or a content creator, this session will help you take control of how you're seen on LinkedIn. Don’t miss it!
___
Google Cal Link

data.title: Youth and Family Summit 2025
data.description:
REGISTER HERE: https://form.jotform.com/250557454681160

The Schrader Lane Youth Task Force is proud to announce it's Youth and Family Summit 2025.

Last year's Youth Summit was so successful, we've planned this year's event to continue our community engagement and advocacy.

There will be:
- fun and games
- panel discussions
- Kid Zone
- Teen Session
- community resources
- food boxes
- engagement with first responders and law enforcement
- CE credits for child care educators
- community service hours for high schoolers and college students

Breakfast and Lunch will be served.

Registration is open until March 26, 2025.

This event is free and open to the public...so bring the ENTIRE family.

We hope to see you March 29, 2025.

#bettertogether
#onecommunity
#schraderlaneyouthtaskforcecommittee

data.title: [COHORT] FE Engineer + Career Strategy: What to expect + Prework
data.description:
Opening session for Cohort 2025-2

Welcome to Cohort 2025-2! This opening session will set you up for success by ensuring you have all the essential tools and accounts needed to fully participate.

What to Expect:

✅ Overview of the Cohort Structure & Expectations
✅ Access to Required Tools & Platforms
✅ Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Your Accounts (LinkedIn, Canva, Google, ChatGPT)
✅ Timeline & Key Milestones for the Next 3 Weeks

We’re giving you a couple weeks to complete your prework so that you start the program fully prepared with everything in place. By the end of this session, you’ll know exactly what to do to ensure a smooth and successful learning experience.
___
Google Cal Link

data.title: [COHORT] Orientation
data.description:
Welcome to Repped School! 🎉 This Orientation Session is designed to help you navigate our virtual space, understand how we operate, and set you up for success in the cohort.

What to Expect:

✅ Tour of the Virtual School – Learn how to access resources, discussion spaces, and support.
✅ How We Communicate – Get familiar with where to find announcements, session links, and important updates.
✅ Signing Up for Sessions – Walkthrough of how to register for upcoming live and self-paced sessions.
✅ Tracking Your Progress – Learn how to stay on top of assignments, resources, and key deadlines.
✅ Where to Ask for Help – Understand how to reach instructors, connect with peers, and get support when needed.

💡 Pro Tip: The more engaged you are, the more you’ll gain from this experience. Dive in, explore, and start making connections!

data.title: Tech Vision Conference 2025
data.description:
Tech Vision 2025 is a *FREE* conference where higher education, community partners, and industry professionals exchange insights on our evolving people technology ecosystem and its impact on the workforce, organizations, and society. Connect with students, discuss workforce trends, and share innovative approaches to artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and digital transformation to shape a better future for our region.

Seating is limited. Please register soon!

Dates:
8:00 AM-4:30 PM (Central), Thursday and Friday, April 10-11, 2025
Please let us know if you plan to attend one or both days in your selections below. 


Location: 
Miller Education Center at Middle Tennessee State University, 503 E Bell St, Murfreesboro, TN 37130
Suite 503A, 2nd Floor

Map to Building:
https://maps.app.goo.gl/WhgyHgi7CZXpxekC9

Free Parking in the Highland Lot:
https://maps.app.goo.gl/TLMwwUiYSoTWyt918
There will also be complimentary shuttles for those already on MTSU's campus. Please email Kristie.Abston@MTSU.edu for a detailed schedule.

ADA Access: 
Email Kristie.Abston@MTSU.edu with
any questions.

Event Page:
https://www.linkedin.com/events/techvision20257302187713619709954/about/
Check back for updates on the program!

Please contact Kristie Abston at Kristie.Abston@MTSU.edu if you have questions or need assistance. If your plans change, then please edit your registration or contact Kristie to cancel. 

Your email address is required below to send you a confirmation email with this information. It will only be used for conference communications.

data.title: LITTLE TABLE NASHVILLE
data.description:
​RSVP HERE: https://lu.ma/kc4v7qmk

Join us for an evening designed to spark meaningful conversations and new connections across the Nashville tech community.

​Our goal: to set a table for professionals from different functions to talk about cross-functional collaboration. You'll walk away with practical ideas to improve collaboration in your own work — and form or enhance relationships with others in tech who approach problems from different angles.

​Whether you're in product, engineering, design, marketing, data, leadership, or another tech role, this event is for you!

​Why You Should Attend

  • ​Networking with Purpose: Engage with fellow tech professionals in a relaxed but thoughtfully structured setting.
  • ​Diverse Perspectives: Meet people from various industries, functions, and experience levels.
  • ​Tailored Discussions: Participate in small group conversations centered around real-world collaboration challenges and wins.

​Agenda

  • ​5:30 - 6:00 PM | Drinks, light snacks, and socializing
  • ​6:00 - 6:05 PM | Welcome announcements
  • ​6:05 - 7:00 PM | Table Talk rounds
    • ​Round 1
    • ​Round 2
  • ​7:00 - 7:30 PM | Additional open networking

​Want to get involved?

​We're looking for Table Host volunteers!
Hosts help kick off each round of conversation and keep the energy welcoming and engaging.

data.title: SQL for AI - August Repped Lab Signup Deadline
data.description:
Join the Signup List for August Repped Lab: SQL for AI

📅 August 4–30, 2025
🆓 Free for Repped Community members during the grant period
📚 Books and resources will be provided

USE COUPON CODE: TN-DSEW-GRANT-PERIOD

Ready to get your hands dirty with the language behind AI and automation? This Repped Lab will guide you through real-world SQL fundamentals and level you up with hands-on experience in a simulated work environment. You’ll move from basic querying to multi-table joins, logic, and more—building skills you can actually use. ﻿﻿

What We'll Work Through

  • Getting your tools and environment set up
  • Learning to ask better questions with data
  • Writing and optimizing your own SQL queries
  • Building confidence in a simulated data workflow

How It Works

Weeks 1–3: Async lab work on your own time
  • Daily office hours + SATURDAY hybrid support sessions
  • Community-first, support-on-request model
Week 4: Live evening Lab Week (in person + virtual)
  • Simulated work environment with Repped Coach support
  • Community Celebration on the final day

✅ To Be Considered, You Must

  • Have a fully completed Repped profile
  • Finish Repped Orientation
  • Introduce yourself in the community
Signups will be reviewed after the deadline. You’ll get a direct message if selected.﻿﻿

What’s Next?

If offered a community seat, you’ll receive a separate email with your Repped Prep materials—watch your inbox and Repped Community notifications so you don’t miss out.

data.title: 🎉 The REPPED LAB Grand OPENING!
data.description:
Join us for the GRAND OPENING of The Repped Lab location.

Learn how to become a Repped Lab member, sign up for labs and get a lay of the land and amenities. 

See you there!

data.title: The Journey: Emerging Tech Leaders Panel
data.description:
Ready to find out what it takes to get into tech? The Journey: Emerging Tech Leaders Panel is your chance to hear straight talk from people who made it happen. Kahlil, Justin, Austin, and Trinity will break down how they got started, what threw them off, what kept them grinding, and what they wish someone had told them. Trevor and Tatiana will keep the convo flowing so you can get your questions answered live.

This is a laid-back panel where you’ll get real stories from real people. Some in the audience are brand new to tech, others are switching careers, but everyone wants to know how to make their move. You’ll kick it off with quick intros, then we’re going straight into Q&A. Lunch is on us if you’re in the room, and we’re streaming it so you can tune in from anywhere.

Event Details:
  • Date & Time: July 11, 2025, at 12:00 PM
  • Setup: Chill panel and open Q&A
  • Virtual: Livestream available
We want you to see what’s possible and know you’re not alone figuring this out.

data.title: Weekly Community Lunch + Office Hours
data.description:
Every Monday | 12 PM CST | Virtual in the Repped Community

Feeling stuck?
Trying to figure out your next move?
Need a tip, a tool, or just a space to say your idea out loud?

Come through for our weekly Repped Lunch + Office Hours.
Bring your questions, your blockers, your “is this even a good idea?” moments. Whether you're building your tech skills, your brand, or your community—this space is for you.

Here’s what to expect:

  • A small, supportive group of other Repped folks just like you
  • Everyone gets a chance to ask a question or share what they’re working through
  • Want feedback? Share your screen. Want a vibe check? We got you.
  • Come for the whole hour or just pop in and out. No pressure.
We're not recording. This is live, real-time support, every week.

✍️ Got a question already? Drop it in the comments below so we can make space for it.
See you Monday. Bring your lunch or just bring yourself.

data.title: Monthly Repped Interest Session
data.description:
12 PM CST | Virtual in the Repped Community

Curious about joining a Repped Sprint, Workshop, or Event — but not sure where to start?

Our Monthly Interest Session is your chance to learn what Repped is all about. In just 30 minutes with 15 minutes open to questions, we’ll walk you through what’s coming up, how to get involved, and how each experience helps you grow your reputation, influence, and tech skills.

Whether you're exploring your options or ready to dive in, this session is a no-pressure space to ask questions, get answers, and meet the community.

We host it once a month. Show up curious — leave with a plan.

✍️ Got a question already? Drop it in the comments below so we can make space for it.
